business.headline: Looking for steady returns? Check who's giving up to 7.65% on 3-year FDsIf you're aiming for safe yet rewarding investments, 3-year fixed deposits are worth a look. Several banks are offering interest rates of up to 7.65%, giving savers a solid balance of security and returns.

EPFO launches Employee Enrolment Scheme 2025: How it benefits workersIn a move to strengthen the formal workforce, the government has rolled out the Employee Enrolment Scheme 2025 under the EPFO. The scheme aims to benefit workers by ensuring PF coverage and long-term financial security.

Amid Tata Trusts row, Ratan Tata's sisters recall his unwavering judgementRatan Tata died on October 9, 2024, at the age of 86. Though he never married, he maintained close relationships with his siblings, brother Jimmy Tata, half-brother Noel Tata, and half-sisters Shireen and Deanna Jejeebhoy.

India triples rare earth magnet investment to cut China reliance: ReportThe new plan represents a major step up from the earlier $290 million initiative, which was focused on ensuring supplies of essential materials for electric vehicles, renewable energy, and defence sectors.

Mehli Mistry sets stage for legal battle after removal from Tata Trusts boardMehli Mistry's caveat sets up a hearing where questions of process, past resolutions, and trust deed interpretation will decide if the non-renewal stands or triggers a deeper inquiry in the coming weeks.

Why India needs a low-tariff trade deal with the US nowA trade pact with the US can expand exports and create millions of jobs, but only if India tackles agriculture and labour reforms. The opportunity is real, and the moment demands resolve.
Sensex, Nifty open in red as private lenders pull markets downThe S&P BSE Sensex was down by 252.57 points to 83,686.14, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 50.40 points to 25,671.70 as of 9:28 am.

Gold prices drop again: What's dragging precious metal rates downOn the Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX) in India, gold futures maturing on December 5, 2025, were trading at Rs 1,21,284 per 10 grams, down by Rs 224 or 0.18%.

Mid-segment housing: Is it the real core of India's property boom?After years of luxury-led projects, India's real estate developers are refocusing on the mid-segment — a market driven by young professionals, dual-income families, and first-time buyers. But is this segment truly the backbone of India's property boom?

The 'missing' Indian-origin CEO behind Rs 4,200 crore BlackRock loan fraudBankim Brahmbhatt, the Indian-origin CEO of a US-based telecom company, is facing a lawsuit in the US filed by HPS, the private credit investment arm of BlackRock.
Gold and silver shine again after slow start. Will they continue to rise?After a dull opening, both gold and silver managed to regain some shine during the day. Will the upward trend continue?

CBI links Anil Ambani, Rana Kapoor in Rs 2,796-crore Yes Bank loss caseThe CBI has accused industrialist Anil Ambani of approving favours to Yes Bank founder Rana Kapoor's family, causing huge financial losses to the bank. This development highlights alleged corruption and risky investments linked to Ambani's companies.

BlackRock-backed firm accuses Indian-origin entrepreneur of $500 million fraudA US-based telecom entrepreneur of Indian origin, Bankim Brahmbhatt, has been accused of orchestrating a USD 500 million loan fraud involving BlackRock-backed lender HPS Investment Partners.

Sensex, Nifty continue losing streak amid profit booking; BEL jumps 4%The S&P BSE Sensex closed 465.75 points lower at 83,938.71, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 155.75 points to 25,722.10. Selling pressure was broad-based, with most sectoral indices ending in the red.

Lenskart IPO crosses full subscription on Day 1; QIBs drive demandThe IPO opened today and closes on November 4. Lenskart has set a price band of Rs 382 to Rs 402 per share, with a lot size of 37 shares for retail bidders.

Gen Z leads India's crypto investments in Q3 2025: ReportThe 18–25 age group has officially overtaken the 26–35 bracket as the most active investors in crypto. For them, digital assets are no longer a risky experiment — they're becoming part of a serious investment plan.

From Groww to ICICI AMC: Key IPOs to watch this November 2025Bengaluru-based investing platform Groww is set to launch its IPO worth Rs 6,632.3 crore. The issue includes a fresh issue of Rs 1,060 crore and an offer for sale of Rs 5,572.3 crore.

Buying your first house? Check the 5x annual income rule and avoid EMI trapA rising number of first-time buyers are running the affordability math more cautiously. From the 5X income rule to avoiding EMI strain, housing decisions are shifting toward sustainability rather than stretch.

HNI India rebrands as Kokuyo Workplace India, targets leadership in Asia by 2030The rebranding marks a key step in Kokuyo's plan to make India a central hub for its Asia-Pacific operations. The move comes after Kokuyo's acquisition of HNI India earlier this year.

entertainment.headline: Allu Arjun grateful after major win at Dadasaheb Phalke Film Festival 2025 Allu Arjun was recognised for his outstanding performance in 'Pushpa 2: The Rule' at the Dadasaheb Phalke Awards. He expressed gratitude and thanked everyone for the recognition.

Hema Malini reassures fans as Dharmendra recovers after brief hospitalisation Veteran actor Dharmendra was admitted to Mumbai's Breach Candy Hospital recently. The actor is currently stable and recovering.

Saiyaara vs Ek Deewane Ki Deewaniyat: Harshvardhan Rane urges fans not to compare Actor Harshvardhan Rane reacted to comparisons between 'Ek Deewane Ki Deewaniyat' and 'Saiyaara'. He requested fans to avoid rivalry and appreciate both creative works as comparisons lead to friction.

Bigg Boss Telugu 9 Day 55: Rashmika Mandanna enters as guest, Madhuri gets eliminated What was meant to be a light-hearted Sunday episode turned into one of the most intense ones of 'Bigg Boss Telugu 9'. After a fiery Saturday, Nagarjuna returned with stern reality checks, emotional confrontations, and a shocking elimination.

Paresh Rawal admits he's bored of Baburao repetition: It dominates my other roles Paresh Rawal opened up about feeling bored of repeatedly playing Baburao, his iconic character from the 'Hera Pheri' film series. The actor said Baburao's popularity often overshadows his other roles.

Stanley Fung, veteran Hong Kong actor and filmmaker, dies at 80 Stanley Fung Shui-fan, well-known for his comedy and film roles in Hong Kong, has died at 80 in New Taipei, just a week after writing a moving farewell for fellow actor Hui Shiu-hung.

Chiranjeevi Dhaba gets green light to use actor's name after legal notice The owner of Chiranjeevi Dhaba in Hyderabad addressed receiving a legal notice for using the star's name and likeness and clarifying the outcome following discussions with Chiranjeevi's team.

Paresh Rawal opens up on lobbying in National Awards: It happens at the Oscars too Paresh Rawal shared that even prestigious honours like the National Awards aren't entirely free from lobbying, drawing parallels with the Oscars. The actor added that he values genuine appreciation from directors and writers over any trophy or title.

Jeet gaye!: Amitabh Bachchan celebrates India's Women's World Cup win India women's cricket team made history by winning their first ICC World Cup title. Bollywood superstar Amitabh Bachchan congratulated the team on social media.

Ek Deewane... vs Thamma vs Kantara 2 box office: Good collections, steady pace The Indian box office witnessed a strong weekend as 'Kantara: Chapter 1', 'Thamma', and 'Ek Deewane Ki Deewaniyat' continued their steady runs. Only 'The Taj Story' underperformed.

Stranger Things 5: Millie Bobby Brown files bullying complaint against co-star Millie Bobby Brown has filed a formal complaint alleging bullying and harassment by co-star David Harbour before filming began for 'Stranger Things' season 5, prompting an internal investigation and heightened attention on set dynamics.

Bigg Boss Tamil 9 highlights: Wildcards criticise housemates for nasty gameplay Wildcard contestants entered Bigg Boss Tamil 9 and criticised housemates for biased gameplay. Their arrival has stirred tensions and may alter house dynamics.

BB19: Abhishek Bajaj's ex-wife Akansha alleges he lied about marriage, age Abhishek Bajaj's ex-wife Akansha Jindal accused him of lying on national television. She shared a lengthy post on Instagram making public allegations about gaslighting audience.

Bigg Boss 19: Malti confronts Amaal, says he lied about their past A recent promo for 'Bigg Boss 19' shows Malti Chahar accusing Amaal Mallik of lying about their relationship on camera, intensifying speculation and discussion among housemates.

Jennifer Aniston goes Instagram official with partner Jim Curtis, fans swoon Jennifer Aniston posted an affectionate birthday message for boyfriend Jim Curtis on Instagram on Monday. She confirmed their relationship and prompted fans to react to possible engagement.

Baahubali The Epic box office Day 3: SS Rajamouli film eyes Rs 25 crore in India SS Rajamouli's remastered 'Baahubali: The Epic' earned Rs 22.56 crore in its opening weekend, overtaking the 2015 film's Hindi debut.

Britney Spears deletes Instagram account after alarming posts, leaving fans worried Britney Spears deleted her online presence following a number of posts about injuries and personal struggles, prompting concern among her supporters.

BB19 Ep 71: Amaal opens up on family's struggles, battling industry gatekeepers During the recent episode of 'Bigg Boss 19', music composer Amaal Mallik revealed previously undisclosed details about his family's financial difficulties and his personal journey in the music industry.

Justin Baldoni's $400 million lawsuit against Blake Lively dismissed. Here's why A $400 million defamation lawsuit filed by Justin Baldoni against Blake Lively was dismissed after Baldoni and his company failed to meet a court deadline to amend their claims, marking the end of a high-profile legal dispute in the Southern District of New York.

general news.headline: Pakistan, China testing nuclear weapons, claims Trump. Concern for India?US President Donald Trump has said that Pakistan and China, apart from Russia and North Korea, are testing nuclear weapons. This is of concern for India as it faces two nuclear-armed rivals on two fronts. Trump made the revelation in a CBS interview, justifying his order to US forces to test nuclear weapons.

India's Women's World Cup win just showed the world what equal pay can doA historic Women's World Cup victory, years in the making, powered by a policy that dared to believe women deserved more. The BCCI's gamble on equality has now rewritten the future of women's sport, in India and beyond.

India was on verge of nuclear war with Pak: New Trump claim amid US's test plansIn an interview, Trump claimed his threat to cut trade ties forced India and Pakistan to step back from the brink of a nuclear exchange during their May 2025 military confrontation.

Amazon fires employees with these two early morning text messagesIn a move that caught many off guard, Amazon employees woke up to text messages informing them that their roles had been eliminated. Here is everything you need to know.

Has Trump created a big nuclear opportunity for India?Will US President Donald Trump's orders to the US military to test nuclear weapons after a 33-year gap restart a nuclear test race? What is the status of India's nuclear weapons stockpile and does India need to participate in such a race?

20 dead in head-on collision between truck, bus in Telangana, PMO announces aidA tragic road accident in Telanaga's Rangareddy district has claimed at least 20 lives and left 20 injured after a speeding truck collided head-on with a TGRTC bus. The incident has sparked an urgent investigation and calls for stricter road safety measures in Telangana.

Tamil Nadu college student gang raped by 3 men near airport, accused on the runA college student in Tamil Nadu's Coimbatore was allegedly gang raped by three men who abducted her after attacking her friend near the Airport area on Sunday night. Police have formed seven special teams to nab them.

Meet your wonder women: The incredible stories of India's world championsWomen's World Cup: The mercurial Indian women's team beat South Africa to win their maiden ODI World Cup. In this article, we explore what our stars look like beyond the cricket field.

Why Indian parents delay divorce until kids are 'old enough'Many Indian parents put off divorce thinking kids will cope better when they're older. But growing up in a quiet, loveless home often leaves deeper scars than separation ever could.

Vreels: A Game-Changing Platform Pushing Social Media Beyond TikTok and InstagramVreels isn't just about sharing, it's about connecting meaningfully. Through built-in chat, voice, and video call features, users can communicate without leaving the app.

BCCI announces Rs 51 crore prize money for Indian women's teamWomen's World Cup: The Indian Cricket Board has announced a bumper prize for the national women's team. UP man kills beedi tycoon father after row over drinking, then shoots himselfThe victim, Suresh Chand Agarwal, was the owner of the Dinesh 555 beedi brand, a company he founded in 1977. He had been battling cancer. Meanwhile, his son, Naresh Agarwal, struggled with a drinking problem, which frequently led to disputes with his father.

Kerala women ask British tourists to return colonial loot in viral videoBritish tourists in Kerala were confronted by local women about Britain's colonial loot, including the Kohinoor diamond, which sparked debate on colonial legacy in India.

Too little chicken, too much drama: UP wedding turns into battlefieldA wedding in Uttar Pradesh's Bijnor's district turned turbulent after a disagreement over chicken fry led to repeated clashes between the families of the bride and the groom, resulting in injuries and requiring police intervention to complete the ceremony.

Pranav Mohanlal: Portrait of an artist as a reticent star kid'Dies Irae' star Pranav Mohanlal is unlike most young stars with film bloodline. He doesn't believe in undue marketing, and would quietly let his work do the talking.

Both are tough, not to be toyed with: Trump's rare praise for Putin, Xi JinpingPresident Donald Trump called Vladimir Putin and Xi Jinping "tough, smart and serious leaders" who can't be taken lightly, while claiming the Ukraine war would never have happened under his administration.

Is Zohran Mamdani a left-wing version of Trump? US President says thisUS President Donald Trump has escalated his criticism of Democratic mayoral candidate Zohran Mamdani, rejecting comparisons between himself and Mamdani during a TV interview and repeating claims that Mamdani is a "communist".

Anil Ambani's home, assets worth over Rs 3,000 crore attached in bank fraud caseAccording to ED officials, the attachment orders were issued on October 31 and the assets include Anil Ambani family's residence at Mumbai's Pali Hill area, the Reliance Centre in New Delhi, and several other residential, commercial and land assets spread across Delhi, Noida, Ghaziabad, Mumbai, Pune, Thane, Hyderabad and Chennai.

sports.headline: Jemimah, Smriti hop on viral 'wake up with trophy' trend after World Cup triumph India batters Jemimah Rodrigues and Smriti Mandhana hopped on to the 'wake up with trophy' trend after their historic maiden World Cup triumph. India beat South Africa by 52 runs to clinch their maiden World Cup title.

Jemimah keeps promise, reveals India's team song after World Cup victory India broke into massive celebrations after winning the Women's ODI World Cup on Sunday. They finally revealed their team song after winning their maiden ICC ODI World Cup trophy.

Shafali Verma bowling was a surprise from India: South Africa's Laura Wolvaardt South Africa skipper Laura Wolvaardt admitted that her side were caught off guard by Shafali Verma's surprise spell for India in the Women's World Cup 2025 final, calling it the decisive moment in such a high stakes match.

Guru-Shishya: Harmanpreet touches coach Amol Muzumdar's feet after World Cup win Women's World Cup: India captain Harmanpreet Kaur touching coach Amol Muzumdar's feet after their World Cup glory became a defining image of respect and gratitude between the two, The duo guided India to their first-ever Women's ODI World Cup triumph.

With grace, Harmanpreet Kaur answers critics of women's cricket after World Cup win India women's cricket team captain Harmanpreet Kaur responded to the widespread criticism of the team following their historic World Cup triumph on home soil. India beat South Africa by 52 runs in the final to claim their maiden World Cup win.

Destiny's champion: Harmanpreet's Punjabi interview with Anjum breaks internet India captain Harmanpreet Kaur gave an emotional interview to Anjum Choopra after her team won the Women's World Cup. The heartfelt interview, given in her native Punjabi language broke the internet.

From 1983 to 2025: Harmanpreet Kaur pulls off a Gavaskar after India's World Cup glory Women's World Cup: Harmanpreet Kaur recreated Sunil Gavaskar's iconic 1983 match-ball gesture after India's World Cup win in Navi Mumbai. The captain pocketed the ball moments after taking the catch that sealed India's historic triumph.

India's Women Clinch Maiden World Cup In Midnight Thriller, Nation Erupts In Joy This special report focuses on the Indian women's cricket team's historic first-ever World Cup victory, a moment that has sent the entire nation into a frenzy. Key figures discussed include captain Harmanpreet Kaur, standout players Deepti Sharma and Richa Ghosh, and the celebratory message from Prime Minister Narendra Modi. One fan from Kolkata captured the national mood, stating he was as happy as he was on '2nd April when Dhoni has lifted the World Cup'. The report covers the emotional and jubilant scenes from Kolkata, where reporter Anirban Sinha Roy is tracking the overnight celebrations. The victory is being hailed as the 'coming of age' for Indian women's cricket, with many comparing its significance to the men's team's 1983 World Cup win. Prime Minister Modi praised the team for their 'spectacular win' and 'exceptional teamwork'.

India's Women World Cup Win: Women In Blue Crowned World Champions For First Time This special report covers the Indian women's cricket team's historic first-ever World Cup victory against South Africa at the D.Y. Patil Stadium in Navi Mumbai. Key figures discussed include captain Harmanpreet Kaur and star performers Shafali Verma and Deepti Sharma. A fan ecstatically proclaimed, 'Indian girls have played very well and they have proved that India has always been number one and will always be number one.' The team chased redemption after final losses in 2005 and 2017, with this victory being their third attempt at the title. India set a formidable target of 299, ultimately defeating South Africa by 52 runs in a landmark moment for Indian sport, reminiscent of the men's 1983 World Cup win.

On wheelchair, Pratika Rawal celebrates India's World Cup win with tricolourWomen's World Cup, IND vs SA: Pratika Rawal wasn't a part of the final against South Africa, but she celebrated India's win on Sunday in Navi Mumbai. Pratika scored 308 runs from seven matches before getting ruled out of the tournament.

Indeed God-sent: Shafali Verma writes her redemption tale in World Cup finalWomen's World Cup final: From being dropped and doubted to dazzling on the grandest stage, Shafali Verma's fearless 87 and inspired bowling spell turned heartbreak into history — a redemption tale that will echo through Indian cricket for generations. God-sent, indeed.

No sleep for 45 days, no problem: Mandhana overcomes heartbreaks with World Cup winSmriti Mandhana opened up on India's emotional journey to their maiden Women's World Cup 2025 title, describing it as a triumph born out of heartbreaks and sleepless nights. On Sunday, India beat South Africa by 52 runs in the final.

India's Women in Blue Conquer the World! PM Modi Hails 'Spectacular' Historic World Cup WinThis special report focuses on the jubilant reactions following the Indian women's cricket team's historic, first-ever World Cup victory, led by a congratulatory message from Prime Minister Narendra Modi. 'A spectacular win by the Indian team in the ICC Women's Cricket World Cup 2025 Finals. Their performance in the final was marked by great skill and confidence,' the Prime Minister stated in a post on X. The nation celebrated as captain Harmanpreet Kaur's team defeated South Africa by 52 runs in a thrilling final in Navi Mumbai to clinch the coveted ICC Women's Cricket World Cup 2025 trophy. This landmark achievement for the 'Women in Blue' is being hailed as a golden moment for Indian cricket, which will inspire a new generation of athletes across the country.

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
